comments.comment: Just wondering if anyone can help with this? Was hoping to use vizdoom to train reinforcement learning agent ... thanks! :D

For now VizDoom cannot work with Anaconda out of the box, we intened to patch this some day (hopefully soon). However I am sure that someone managed to use vizdoom on anaconda (maybe here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mwydmuch/ViZDoom/issues/167>#167</denchmark-link> ).

Hello, I was able to solve the problem! Thanks to very helpful suggestion of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ajschumacher>@ajschumacher</denchmark-link> in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mwydmuch/ViZDoom/issues/167>#167</denchmark-link> . I copy file 'libpython2.7.so' from anaconda2/lib/ to anaconda2/lib/python2.7/config/ like this: cp /home/tyler/anaconda2/lib/libpython2.7.so /home/tyler/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/config/libpython2.7.so Magically, pip install vizdoom worked very quickly after that! However, when I tried to import it gave me problem about GLIBCXX not found version. I then solve this one too, so I will put the solution worked for me in this one too ... hope that is ok. First tried: <denchmark-link:https://askubuntu.com/questions/575505/glibcxx-3-4-20-not-found-how-to-fix-this-error>https://askubuntu.com/questions/575505/glibcxx-3-4-20-not-found-how-to-fix-this-error</denchmark-link> and did the top answer lines ... this did not solve, but might need to set-up the correct solution? Then tried: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ContinuumIO/anaconda-issues/issues/483>ContinuumIO/anaconda-issues#483</denchmark-link> ... solved after using

I don't know why vizdoom cannot be installed in conda python, but it can be installed in local python. With "sudo pip install .", the package will be installed into /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages. If you copy this packages folder into ~/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages, it will works fine.
